derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent. (denoting raw cotton or cotton wool used as padding, later used figuratively): from Old French bombace, from medieval Latin bombax, bombac-, alteration of bombyx 'silkworm' (see bombazine)

entry.def: Bombast is trying to impress people by saying things that sound impressive but have little meaning.

example.ex: There was no bombast or conceit in his speech.
example.tran: 他的演讲并没有夸大其词和自吹自擂。

means.word_mean: 1. pompous or pretentious talk or writing
